description: Single storey basement extension with one front lightwell with a metal grille covering and two rear lightwells with hardened glazed covering and alterations to the existing single storey rear infill and side extensions to the house.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [2202-0100-001 (Rev P03); 2202-0200-002 (P03); 2202-0200-003 (Rev P03); 2202-0200-004 (P03); 2202-0200-005 (P03); 2202-0200-006 (P03) Received: 31 August 2023
2202-0200-001 (Rev P02); 2202-0200-002 (P02); 2202-0200-003 (P02); 2202-0200-004 (P02); 2202-0200-005 (P02); 2202-0200-006 (P02); Unreferenced Location Plan Received: 13 June 2023].

Condition : 3 - During works, an appropriate wheel-washing system shall be operated to remove mud, stones and other extraneous materials from vehicle wheels and chassis' leaving the site, and all departing loads shall be fully covered to ensure no material is deposited on the highway. The exit from the wheel wash shall be a hard, non-porous surface sited as far away from the exit as is possible given the site constraints and kept clean at all times.  Waste water discharged from the wheel wash shall be stored and disposed of on site and not discharged into the public sewer unless soil, stones and any suspended material have first been removed.
The developer shall ensure that no dust or other debris is carried on to adjoining properties in accordance with the guidance at https://www.london.gov.uk/file/18750/download?token=zV3ZKTpP. 
Site lighting shall be designed, positioned and directed so as not to unnecessarily intrude on passing drivers or direct light into any neighbouring windows in accordance with the guidance provided by the Institute of Lighting Engineers Guidance Note: For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light 2021.
All vehicle arrivals and departures shall be supervised and the condition of the highway examined immediately afterwards.  Any materials shed from the vehicle during such movement shall be immediately removed from the highway, and returned to site or carted away for disposal and shall not be washed into the surface water drainage system

Condition : 4 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public.
Condition : 5 - The single storey basement extension hereby approved shall be implemented in accordance with the submitted Construction Method Statement (Ref:  20221205-01).

Condition : 6 - All flooding prevention measures detailed in the submitted Flood Risk Assessment shall be implemented prior to the completion of development and be permanently retained and maintained as such.

Condition : 7 - The front lightwell hereby approved shall be covered with a walk-on metal grille positioned to be level with the front courtyard's ground surface level and be permanently retained as such.  

The two rear lightwells hereby approved shall be covered with walk-on hardened glazing positioned to be level with the rear garden's ground surface level and be permanently retained as such.
Condition : 8 - The single storey basement extension hereby approved shall not include primary residential uses, including bedrooms and kitchens, or be subdivided into a self-contained flat.
